ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Michael Maurice Cox  Accessible and quick to answer questions, but could do more to help instructor be organized.
Instructor: Michael Maurice Cox  Very helpful and quick to respond to questions.
Instructor: Michael Maurice Cox  Very organized and provided useful feedback throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This class needs organizational help. There needs to be a clear outline of where the "green" part of this buildings class is, because otherwise it's just like any other building seminar. The professor should work on leading an organized discussion, potentially using powerpoint slides or a more structured format. There is way too much administrative discussion at the beginning of class, and generally, not enough structure to the course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I enjoyed the guest speaker presentations
The field trip was really interesting and helpful. I liked working on my individual project as well.
The Brattleboro field trip and the broad systems-thinking presented in the class. I liked how the class was a survey course that presented the many aspects of the built environment!
The instructor is a practitioner and is extremely knowledgable about the subject

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: -eliminating "busy work" assignments, like the forum postings -providing a broader variety of readings (not just all BuildingGreen articles) -less technical content and readings -more "green" information -more structure
I didn't love the weekly forum posts--some weeks it seemed people (and myself) just scrambled to write a question down without a ton of interaction.
- We spent too much time on logistics at the beginning of every class - I wish we spend more time on the technical aspects of how building worksf

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in how the built environment relates to health and environmental sustainability.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes--I feel more knowledgeable in building science.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This class, as it is currently structured, is too superficial and disorganized to be a good source of information about green buildings.
Complete the readings--it will make the discussion more meaningful.
